medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain, primarily in the right lower quadrant (RLQ), accompanied by nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 9:30 PM after returning from dinner. Initially experienced tightness and acute pain, which progressed to nausea and vomiting. Pain moved from the initial location to the supra-pubic area before localizing to the RLQ. The patient reported chills and a warm sensation in the head, with poor sleep due to continuous vomiting (7 times) and pain. She mentioned a hard bowel movement during the night but no diarrhea or further bowel movements since. Current pain is less severe if still and worsens when moving.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of melanoma in situ (s/p excision), basal cell carcinoma of the left mid-nose, seborrheic keratosis, actinic keratosis, osteoporosis, traumatic T7 compression fracture, pulmonary nodule, meningioma, colonic adenoma, shingles, and multiple fractures (humerus, ankle, ribs, compression fractures).
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes colon cancer (mother, passed at unspecified age) and thyroid cancer (daughters, adenocarcinoma).
